HomePage.eeee-paragraph: EEEE stand for EPFL Exchange Events Exporter. This app is used to return all calendars event of conference resource, inside a data file as csv, json...
HomePage.guid-paragraph: To use it, you need first to connect to your @epfl microsoft account, and next, to complete the export form

Form.resetLabel: Are you sure to reset the form ? All datas will disappear.
Form.loaderNbData: {nb, plural, =1 {Exporting the event, please wait} other {Exporting {nb} events, please wait}}
Form.errPeriodTooHigh: Incorrect dates. The period between the start date and the end date is too long.
Form.errPeriodEndBeforeStart: Incorrect dates. The end date is before the start date.
Form.errUserUnavailable: Incorrect user or user calendar inaccessible.
Form.errInvalidResource: Incorrect resource or resource calendar inaccessible.
Form.ErrorInvalidUser: Incorrect user or user calendar inaccessible.
Form.errUserNoData: No data exists in the period provided.
Form.errUserAccessMissing: You don't have required rights to access this calendar.
Form.errTooHighRange: The specified view range exceeds the maximum range of two years.
Form.errTooMuchData: There is too much data in the provided period: {nb}. The maximum allowed is 1000.
Form.errTokenExpired: Access token expired. Refresh the page or log in again.

status.title: Status of request
status.success: 'success', which is returned when request run correctly.
status.info: 'info', which is returned when request give an error, due to bad request (wrong dates, wrong resources...).
status.warning: 'warning', which is returned when request give an error, due to something which block the request (wrong or missing credentials, server error...).

GET.title: Get resource's reservations during provided period

resource.title: resource
resource.explanation: The field {name} is a {type} in a {format} format. This field is {isRequired, select, true {required} other {optional}}, and correspond to the email address's resource which you want to export reservations, with {acceptedSynthax} as suffix.

start.title: start
start.explanation: The field {name} is a {type} in a {format} format. This field is {isRequired, select, true {required} other {optional}}, and correspond to the begin of the period of event extraction, with {acceptedSynthax} as suffix.

end.title: end
end.explanation: The field {name} is a {type} in a {format} format. This field is {isRequired, select, true {required} other {optional}}, and correspond to the end of the period of event extraction, with {acceptedSynthax} as suffix.

select.title: select
select.explanation: The field {name} is a {type} in a {format} format. This field is {isRequired, select, true {required} other {optional}}, and correspond to the key manager. In this field, write only key you want to show or rename. Each key are separated by a comma (,) and to rename a key, just add colon (:) between original key name and new key name for this request. The list of available original key name are the following :

keyArrayExplanation.start: The datetime when this event start
keyArrayExplanation.end: The datetime when this event end
keyArrayExplanation.subject: The event's name
keyArrayExplanation.email: The email address of event's organizer

authorization.title: Authorization
authorization.explanation: The field {name} is a {type} in a {format} format. This field is {isRequired, select, true {required} other {optional}}, and correspond to your accessToken, started with {acceptedSynthax}. This field is required only if you call this endpoint outside this web browser where you're connected to this page.

errCredentials.title: Connection not etablished
errCredentials.message: Authentication error, please connecting you to your account.
errCredentials.explanation: This error may occurs when credentials is wrong or is missing. Credentials could be a username (email) and password or simply an accessToken from Graph API.

errParameters.title: Parameters error
errParameters.message: Arguments error, please check `parameter name` parameters and try again.
errParameters.explanation: This error occurs when parameters in the request is wrong.

errTooMuchData.title: Too much data
errTooMuchData.message: Your request can't be completed. The range between the start and end dates contains more events that the API can manage. `quantity` are returned and the max is 1000
errTooMuchData.explanation: This error occurs when the range between your start date and end date contains more than 1000 events.

errUserAccessMissing.title: Missing rights
errUserAccessMissing.explanation: This error occurs when you don't have the rights to access the requested resource.

errTooHighRange.title: Too High period range
errTooHighRange.message: The specified view range exceeds the maximum range of two years.
errTooHighRange.explanation: This error occurs when the range between start date and end date is too high.

errEWSRequest.title: EWS request errors
errEWSRequest.explanation: This error occurs when error is returned by EWS API. Please refer to official EWS documentations.

errInvalidResource.title: Resource error
errInvalidResource.explanation: This error occurs when requested resource doesn't exist or is wrong.

errMissingArgs.title: Param√®tres manquants
errMissingArgs.explanation: This error occurs when a required parameters is missing.
